business.headline: No tax payable up to Rs 12 lakh income: Budget bonanza for middle classFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that taxpayers with salaries up to Rs 12 lakh would not be required to pay tax in the new tax regime.

Boost for MSMEs, classification investment cap to be hiked 2.5 times The Indian government would strengthen the country's MSME sector.

Budget for common man, says PM Modi at Cabinet meet: SourcesBudget 2025-2026 is likely to provide a much-needed boost to the middle class amid high inflation with the nation's GDP growth projected to slow down to a four-year low of 6.4 per cent.

India's GDP growth projected at 6.3-6.8% for fiscal 2025-26: Economic SurveyThe Economic Survey said that the manufacturing sector faced pressures due to weak global demand and domestic seasonal conditions.

Budget 2025: 5 top expectations of middle class from new tax regimeUnion Budget 2025: Taxpayers are anticipating that the government may raise the basic exemption limit from Rs 3,00,000 to Rs 5,00,000 under the new regime, offering more disposable income and increased savings.

Will stock market open for trading on budget day? Check hereSensex, Nifty on budget day: Investors are on their toes looking for cues to tell them if market bulls will be dominant or will bearish sentiments take over.

Sensex, Nifty rise as markets bet on Budget 2025 for growth push; L&T up 5%Stock Market: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 161.56 points to 76,921.37, while the NSE Nifty added 64.60 points to 23,314.10 as of 9:25 AM.

Nirmala Sitharaman to present Economic Survey today. Check key detailsUnion Budget 2025: The Economic Survey is an important document that reviews the country's financial health over the past year and provides insights into economic trends, challenges, and opportunities.

entertainment.headline: Singer Udit Narayan on controversy over kissing female fans: Hum decent log haiVideos of singer Udit Narayan kissing female fans on the lips during a live performance went viral. Now, the singer has addressed the controversy and called it fans' 'deewangi', and said it shouldn't be given so much attention.

Stunning pics from Raftaar-Manraj's Sikh and South Indian wedding ceremoniesRapper Raftaar married fashion stylist Manraj Jawanda in a dual wedding ceremony recently. The two shared a few dreamy pictures from their two weddings on social media.

Ibrahim Ali Khan-Khushi Kapoor ready for 'Nadaaniyan' in his debut Netflix filmIbrahim Ali Khan announced his debut film, titled Nadaaniyan, with Khushi Kapoor on Saturday. It's a Netflix film directed by Shauna Gautam.

At one point, Chris also folded his hands and greeted the fellow devotees at the Sangam.

Pic: Emily in Paris actor Lily Collins, husband Charlie McDowell welcome baby girlActor Lily Collins and director Charlie McDowell have become parents to a baby girl via surrogate. They shared the happy news on social media, along with a picture of the baby.

Marco OTT release: When and where to watch Unni Mukundan's gory thrillerMarco OTT Release Date: After having a phenomenal run at the box office, the Malayalam gore film Marco is set to release on OTT. Starring Unni Mukundan in the lead role, the film will release on Sony LIV in February.

For the love of Korean variety shows In this week's installment of Weekly K-Fix, we discuss a specific genre of Korean entertainment -- their variety shows. From superstars such as BTS and Seventeen, to the beloved MC Yoo Jae-Suk, everyone has appeared in them. Here's a quick look at why they are so popular in South Korea.

However, she did not start her career as a singer, she was an actor for a famous Disney show, Boy Meets World. Let's take a look back at Sabrina's remarkable evolution over the years.

Sitarist Anoushka Shankar to present at the 67th Grammy premiere ceremonySitarist Anoushka Shankar will be a presenter at the 67th Grammy Premiere Ceremony. The event will precede the main Grammy Awards.

Dabba Cartel teaser: Shabana Azmi leads all-women syndicate in high-stakes dramaDabba Cartel teaser is finally out. The Netflix series starring Shabana Azmi, Gajraj Rao, Jyotika, Nimisha Sajayan, Shalini Pandey and others, will premiere on February 28.

Budget 2025 brings Rs 1 lakh crore fund to transform cities into growth hubs  Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday announced the establishment of a Rs1 lakh crore Urban Challenge Fund to drive the transformation of cities into growth hubs, support creative redevelopment, and enhance water and sanitation infrastructure, as outlined in the July Budget.

Live: Mega relief for middle class, Nirmala Sitharaman says no income tax up to Rs 12 lakhUnion Budget Speech Live Updates: The countdown has begun for Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to present the Union Budget 2025-26 today. All eyes are on her announcements, which are likely to focus on tax relief for the middle class, continued focus on infrastructure spending, and maintaining fiscal discipline. This is due to a projected slowdown in GDP growth, persistently high inflation and sluggish consumption. Tax reforms, including an increase in the basic exemption limit and a potential new tax bracket under the new regime, are among the key expectations. But ticking all the boxes will be tough, given the fact that achieving a fiscal deficit target of 4.5 per cent remains a challenge. Will the Finance Minister manage to strike the right balance? Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the live updates.

8 Budgets, 8 sarees, 8 milestones: Nirmala Sitharaman sets recordBudget 2025: Nirmala Sitharaman made history by presenting her eighth consecutive budget, the highest by any Finance Minister in India. She has also become known for wearing a different saree for each budget presentation, that represents India's rich textile heritage and traditional craftsmanship.

Stock Market Live Updates: Sensex tanks nearly 500 points despite tax reliefStock Market Live, Sensex Nifty: The announcements made during the Budget can have an impact on Dalal Street, with positive measures boosting investor confidence and negative ones causing market corrections.

Budget for Youth 2025: Schools get broadband, AI education boost, new medical seatsThe Union Budget 2025 introduced broadband in schools, AI in education, new skilling centres, and expansion of medical and IIT seats to boost learning and job opportunities for India's youth.

Udan to expand to 120 airports, fly 4 crore more passengers in next 10 yearsNirmala Sitharaman announced plans to connect 120 new airports over the next 10 years, benefiting 4 crore additional passengers. The "UDAN" scheme will connect 88 small cities, expanding air travel access and affordability.

Trump says no chance of tariff deadline delay, Trudeau vows 'forceful' responseTrump said the tariffs will remain in place until Mexico and Canada take stronger action to curb migration and fentanyl trafficking. Asked if there was room for negotiation, he dismissed the idea outright.

Harshit Rana makes T20I debut as concussion substitute vs England in PuneIndia vs England: Harshit Rana was approved as Shivam Dube's concussion substitute in the Pune clash, marking his T20I debut for India. Dube had hit a brilliant fifty in the fourth T20I to rescue India from troubled waters.

United won't be a part of the playoffs as they finished 3rd in the league phase of the competition.

No Saim Ayub as Mohammed Rizwan to lead Pakistan's 15-man squadChampions Trophy 2025: Mohammed Rizwan will lead Pakistan's 15-man squad for the ICC 50-over tournament. Saim Ayub missed out due to an injury as Fakhar Zaman returned to the Pakistan side.

Pakistan board chief assures Karachi, Lahore stadiums ready for Champions TrophyChampions Trophy 2025: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chairman Mohsin Naqvi assured that Lahore, Karachi, and Rawalpindi are ready to host the ICC tournament as scheduled.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
